GOD.content: Plato’s responsibility, or discipline, press one secret to work in service of another, put the demonic secret of Eros to work in this new hierarchy
GOD.linkedContent: Plato’s responsibility, or discipline, press one secret to work in service of another, put the demonic secret of Eros to work in this new hierarchy

GOD.content: desire engenders fault, it is the failing itself [of God]
GOD.linkedContent: desire engenders fault, it is the failing itself [of God]

GOD.content: story of flood, of Noah, hesitate forever btwn justice & perversion: God won’t forgive himself for the fault in man, for man’s desire, regrets his creation
GOD.linkedContent: story of flood, of Noah, hesitate forever btwn justice & perversion: God won’t forgive himself for the fault in man, for man’s desire, regrets his creation

GT.content: [re: Madame de Maintenon (Maintenant)] desire as desire to give what one cannot give, pour le pouvoir de donner
GT.linkedContent: [re: Madame de Maintenon (Maintenant)] desire as desire to give what one cannot give, pour le pouvoir de donner

GT.content: why desire to interrupt circulation of circle, why desire the gift?
GT.linkedContent: why desire to interrupt circulation of circle, why desire the gift?

GT.content: even if gift is a simulacrum, il faut (one must) rendre compte (render an account) of the possibility of this simulacrum, and render account of desire to render account > can’t be done w/out principle of reason (principium reddendae rationis)
GT.linkedContent: even if gift is a simulacrum, il faut (one must) rendre compte (render an account) of the possibility of this simulacrum, and render account of desire to render account > can’t be done w/out principle of reason (principium reddendae rationis)

GT.content: which law obligates one to answer for, to account for, a gift that calls one beyond all responsibility?
GT.linkedContent: which law obligates one to answer for, to account for, a gift that calls one beyond all responsibility?

GT.content: the alogos, madness, of rendering account (logos) of the atopos (the gift), desire to think the impossible, to desire, to desire to give the impossible: madness as given & desired forgetting
GT.linkedContent: the alogos, madness, of rendering account (logos) of the atopos (the gift), desire to think the impossible, to desire, to desire to give the impossible: madness as given & desired forgetting

GT.content: how could one desire a gift that is non-ambivalent? a gift that would not be pharmakon, poison, that would be good? how does one desire forgetting
GT.linkedContent: how could one desire a gift that is non-ambivalent? a gift that would not be pharmakon, poison, that would be good? how does one desire forgetting

GT.content: demand of gift/countergift, circulatory differance, requirement of restitution “at term,” delayed “due date,” thing itself demands gift & restitution
GT.linkedContent: demand of gift/countergift, circulatory differance, requirement of restitution “at term,” delayed “due date,” thing itself demands gift & restitution

GT.content: demand for term & temporization, very structure of the thing, demand for limit, boundary, margin, a demand which dawns in gift-counter-gift
GT.linkedContent: demand for term & temporization, very structure of the thing, demand for limit, boundary, margin, a demand which dawns in gift-counter-gift

GT.content: beggars (in their exteriority) can represent absolute demand of the Other, inextinguishable appeal, unquenchable thirst for the gift
GT.linkedContent: beggars (in their exteriority) can represent absolute demand of the Other, inextinguishable appeal, unquenchable thirst for the gift

R.content: questions of politics must pass through desire and pleasure
R.linkedContent: questions of politics must pass through desire and pleasure

R.content: desire for democracy for impossible freedom (Rousseau)
R.linkedContent: desire for democracy for impossible freedom (Rousseau)

MONL.content: disorder of identity: does it favor or inhibit anamnesia? heighten desire for memory? both! exhausts us, point of losing our breath, our minds
MONL.linkedContent: disorder of identity: does it favor or inhibit anamnesia? heighten desire for memory? both! exhausts us, point of losing our breath, our minds

MONL.content: universal value of “I only have one language, it is not mine:” immanent structure of promise or desire, expectation w/out horizon
MONL.linkedContent: universal value of “I only have one language, it is not mine:” immanent structure of promise or desire, expectation w/out horizon

MONL.content: desire is borne by the arrival itself, before ipseity (I-me)
MONL.linkedContent: desire is borne by the arrival itself, before ipseity (I-me)

MONL.content: Derrida dreams of leaving marks that recall the entirely other prior-to-the-first language: degree zero-minus-one of memory, a desire for infinite salvation: scratch and graft, caress with claws, borrowed [see DEBT] claws
MONL.linkedContent: Derrida dreams of leaving marks that recall the entirely other prior-to-the-first language: degree zero-minus-one of memory, a desire for infinite salvation: scratch and graft, caress with claws, borrowed [see DEBT] claws

MONL.content: let all my specters loose, a desire w/out horizon
MONL.linkedContent: let all my specters loose, a desire w/out horizon

LOBL.content: call (demand, order, desire), “come”-effect of “first name” transcends all categories, thus strictly can be called transcendental, quī transcendit omne genus
LOBL.linkedContent: call (demand, order, desire), “come”-effect of “first name” transcends all categories, thus strictly can be called transcendental, quī transcendit omne genus

LOBL.content: [interdiction as desire?] what remains beyond its reach is precisely what revives it at every moment
LOBL.linkedContent: [interdiction as desire?] what remains beyond its reach is precisely what revives it at every moment

LOBL.content: vitrifying structure of writing & desire > hymen (as syllepsis) and pane of glass; p. ~141 Blanchot: glass doesn’t use up what I enjoy, reads book behind pane of glass
LOBL.linkedContent: vitrifying structure of writing & desire > hymen (as syllepsis) and pane of glass; p. ~141 Blanchot: glass doesn’t use up what I enjoy, reads book behind pane of glass

LOBL.content: desire in a glass coffin [see SPOM p. 142 revolution shatters death masks in glass caskets]
LOBL.linkedContent: desire in a glass coffin [see SPOM p. 142 revolution shatters death masks in glass caskets]

LOBL.content: everything took place as if narrator desired that the 2 women resembled each other > in accordance w/ hymen
LOBL.linkedContent: everything took place as if narrator desired that the 2 women resembled each other > in accordance w/ hymen

AF.content: desire for archive: homesickness for the archaic place of absolute commencement > en mal d’archive [in need of archive, in archive fever, in death drive]
AF.linkedContent: desire for archive: homesickness for the archaic place of absolute commencement > en mal d’archive [in need of archive, in archive fever, in death drive]

AF.content: when stones speak, when desire is revealed as a memory, moves us into the future
AF.linkedContent: when stones speak, when desire is revealed as a memory, moves us into the future

AF.content: “one can always dream or speculate around this secret account”—no archive of the secret, it is ash itself
AF.linkedContent: “one can always dream or speculate around this secret account”—no archive of the secret, it is ash itself

SPOM.content: [re: Blanchot’s “always present” demand] must remain a can-be or a maybe in order to remain a demand, remain urgent
SPOM.linkedContent: [re: Blanchot’s “always present” demand] must remain a can-be or a maybe in order to remain a demand, remain urgent

SPOM.content: injunction, pledge, “necessary” promise “il faut l’avenir” marks any opening to the event and conditions interest (not indifference) to anything whatsoever, to all content, no desire w/out it
SPOM.linkedContent: injunction, pledge, “necessary” promise “il faut l’avenir” marks any opening to the event and conditions interest (not indifference) to anything whatsoever, to all content, no desire w/out it

SPOM.content: l’épreuve de l’indécidabilitié & “it is necessary” of emancipatory desire > condition of re-politicization, perhaps another concept of political
SPOM.linkedContent: l’épreuve de l’indécidabilitié & “it is necessary” of emancipatory desire > condition of re-politicization, perhaps another concept of political

SPOM.content: “arithmetical desire” finds its spur, its origin, in the fact that ghosts are innumerable
SPOM.linkedContent: “arithmetical desire” finds its spur, its origin, in the fact that ghosts are innumerable

SPOM.content: le longtemps, c’est le temps de cette chasse à l’éloignement (hunt for distance, a hunt w/ distance > pray & lure): distance hunt can only hallucinate, desire, defer proximity: lure & prey
SPOM.linkedContent: le longtemps, c’est le temps de cette chasse à l’éloignement (hunt for distance, a hunt w/ distance > pray & lure): distance hunt can only hallucinate, desire, defer proximity: lure & prey

SPOM.content: specter is social, otherwise no desire, no love, no peace, no socius, no war
SPOM.linkedContent: specter is social, otherwise no desire, no love, no peace, no socius, no war

SPOM.content: the impossible (“to let the dead bury their dead”) is possible, absolute evil (fully present life which doesn’t want to hear/know death), takes place (peut avoir lieu) > on basis of this terrible possibility, justice is desirable (through but also beyond law, right) [cf. HST p. 399]
SPOM.linkedContent: the impossible (“to let the dead bury their dead”) is possible, absolute evil (fully present life which doesn’t want to hear/know death), takes place (peut avoir lieu) > on basis of this terrible possibility, justice is desirable (through but also beyond law, right) [cf. HST p. 399]

POOF.content: in Lysis, existence of friend for sake of enemy (ekthrou éneka) is abandoned for hypothesis of desire (épithumia): friend is friend of what he desires, the oikeiéotēs, home, habitat, familiar, property, hómoion, the present, near, neighbor > friend: everything an economy can reconcile
POOF.linkedContent: in Lysis, existence of friend for sake of enemy (ekthrou éneka) is abandoned for hypothesis of desire (épithumia): friend is friend of what he desires, the oikeiéotēs, home, habitat, familiar, property, hómoion, the present, near, neighbor > friend: everything an economy can reconcile

POOF.content: Derrida sees disjunction generating desire via Symposium: one desire whats belongs & that what belongs is Good [?]
POOF.linkedContent: Derrida sees disjunction generating desire via Symposium: one desire whats belongs & that what belongs is Good [?]

POOF.content: desire for one single friendship exposes possibility & impossibility of indivisible calculation: one time for all time(s) will never cease, immediately infinite in its finiteness, appears as such only in unceasing desire for repetition/multiplication [cf. Augustine in Confessions] > the subject, the ‘one’ friend is indivisible in its calculable identity, indivisible in its incalculable singularity, the one divides the other: it is here that the enemy is w/in the friend
POOF.linkedContent: desire for one single friendship exposes possibility & impossibility of indivisible calculation: one time for all time(s) will never cease, immediately infinite in its finiteness, appears as such only in unceasing desire for repetition/multiplication [cf. Augustine in Confessions] > the subject, the ‘one’ friend is indivisible in its calculable identity, indivisible in its incalculable singularity, the one divides the other: it is here that the enemy is w/in the friend

POOF.content: Blanchot no longer has affinity w/ one Nietzsche (there is always plus d’un): friendship is not a gift or promise, it’s the outside drawing near in its separateness/inaccessibility—pure desire is the call to bridge (à franchir) the distance, to die in common through separation
POOF.linkedContent: Blanchot no longer has affinity w/ one Nietzsche (there is always plus d’un): friendship is not a gift or promise, it’s the outside drawing near in its separateness/inaccessibility—pure desire is the call to bridge (à franchir) the distance, to die in common through separation

POOF.content: desire in lovence (friendship or love) engages me w/ a particular him or her, a singular ‘who,’ desire of the call to bridge (à franchir) the distance (nécessairement infranchissable), where a politics of lovence would no longer imply motifs of community, which always risks bringing a brother back > risk must still be assumed to keep question of ‘who’ from being politically enframed (arraisonner) by schema of l'être-commun
POOF.linkedContent: desire in lovence (friendship or love) engages me w/ a particular him or her, a singular ‘who,’ desire of the call to bridge (à franchir) the distance (nécessairement infranchissable), where a politics of lovence would no longer imply motifs of community, which always risks bringing a brother back > risk must still be assumed to keep question of ‘who’ from being politically enframed (arraisonner) by schema of l'être-commun

POO.content: as if everyone had one noncontradictory desire [re: participating in a seminar]
POO.linkedContent: as if everyone had one noncontradictory desire [re: participating in a seminar]

POO.content: how a ceremony or ritual “consolidates” desire, foreplay (Vorlust)
POO.linkedContent: how a ceremony or ritual “consolidates” desire, foreplay (Vorlust)

HERP.content: for Heidegger, Heraclitus and poets [?] experience lovence (aimance), before philosophy, love w/out strife before Eros, desire, or, at least, a jealous tension
HERP.linkedContent: for Heidegger, Heraclitus and poets [?] experience lovence (aimance), before philosophy, love w/out strife before Eros, desire, or, at least, a jealous tension

HERP.content: to strive to recall—nostalgia; Aristotle, metaphysics: reactive nostalgia, a mourning for originary philein, semideafness that hears but not the originary gathering of logos
HERP.linkedContent: to strive to recall—nostalgia; Aristotle, metaphysics: reactive nostalgia, a mourning for originary philein, semideafness that hears but not the originary gathering of logos

HERP.content: philosophy “stand[s] in the tensing of this nostalgic tension,” Suchen, orexis, search, quest, investigation is tension of a desire
HERP.linkedContent: philosophy “stand[s] in the tensing of this nostalgic tension,” Suchen, orexis, search, quest, investigation is tension of a desire

HERP.content: for Heidegger, philosophy seeks after, comes later than harmony, this delay eroticizes philosophical search, tension of Eros; Heraclitus & Parmenides not philosophers, no straining, no erotic pas, in accord, Einklang, homology w/ logos
HERP.linkedContent: for Heidegger, philosophy seeks after, comes later than harmony, this delay eroticizes philosophical search, tension of Eros; Heraclitus & Parmenides not philosophers, no straining, no erotic pas, in accord, Einklang, homology w/ logos

HERP.content: for Heidegger, originary Eris [Derrida had just mentioned Eros] as truth of philia—Blake’s “opposition is true friendship”
HERP.linkedContent: for Heidegger, originary Eris [Derrida had just mentioned Eros] as truth of philia—Blake’s “opposition is true friendship”

HERP.content: moment of question as struggle, moment of Eros when philosophy becomes a question tensed/plunged into mourning, jealous/inquisitive about being?
HERP.linkedContent: moment of question as struggle, moment of Eros when philosophy becomes a question tensed/plunged into mourning, jealous/inquisitive about being?

HASD.content: Christianity, event of event > closer to agathon than khōra
this Good inspires an entire erotics [erôs more worth of God than agapè?]
HASD.linkedContent: this Good inspires an entire erotics [erôs more worth of God than agapè?]

A.content: for Heidegger, only a “being-to-death” can think, desire, project, live immortality as such
A.linkedContent: for Heidegger, only a “being-to-death” can think, desire, project, live immortality as such

VM.content: Levinas’ desire (metaphysics, ethics, metaphysical transcendence) unlike Hegel’s desire which requires negation and assimilation; for Hegel, acc. Levinas, desire is not separated from enjoyment, only deferred in work (thus, Hegelian desire would be same as need); desire, for Levinas, appeal to absolute, exterior other, infinitely inadequate, equal only to excess
VM.linkedContent: Levinas’ desire (metaphysics, ethics, metaphysical transcendence) unlike Hegel’s desire which requires negation and assimilation; for Hegel, acc. Levinas, desire is not separated from enjoyment, only deferred in work (thus, Hegelian desire would be same as need); desire, for Levinas, appeal to absolute, exterior other, infinitely inadequate, equal only to excess

VM.content: for Kierkegaard, movement of desire can be what it is in renunciation of desire [Levinas seems Kierkegaardian despite his protests]
VM.linkedContent: for Kierkegaard, movement of desire can be what it is in renunciation of desire [Levinas seems Kierkegaardian despite his protests]

VM.content: Levinas very close to Hegel [re: relation btwn desire & eye], closer than he admits, something that happens to all anti-Hegelian thinkers [this calls for much more thought]
VM.linkedContent: Levinas very close to Hegel [re: relation btwn desire & eye], closer than he admits, something that happens to all anti-Hegelian thinkers [this calls for much more thought]

VM.content: for Hegel, sight is neutral, does not consume; for Levinas, sight is not neutral, desires, but, like Hegel, doesn’t consume
VM.linkedContent: for Hegel, sight is neutral, does not consume; for Levinas, sight is not neutral, desires, but, like Hegel, doesn’t consume

PAS.content: neither univocity nor dialectics of desire [no reconciled, simple “passion”] can frame the pas of Anne’s final intrusion into her name, her nothingness
PAS.linkedContent: neither univocity nor dialectics of desire [no reconciled, simple “passion”] can frame the pas of Anne’s final intrusion into her name, her nothingness

PAS.content: ce désir de la paralysie qui n’arrête jamais
PAS.linkedContent: ce désir de la paralysie qui n’arrête jamais

PAS.content: paralysis that does not prohibit anything, that makes movement [see ROP p. 21] > le faux mouvement qui procède selon le faut-pas du désir et franchit la limite
PAS.linkedContent: paralysis that does not prohibit anything, that makes movement [see ROP p. 21] > le faux mouvement qui procède selon le faut-pas du désir et franchit la limite

PAS.content: wanting (le vouloir) to break fascination always effect of fascination? why break it? I love and desire fascination, any desire w/out it? [tu me fascine, je t’aime]; viens, word of fascination, defers in difference what it cannot break with—dare that another dissimulation not come
PAS.linkedContent: wanting (le vouloir) to break fascination always effect of fascination? why break it? I love and desire fascination, any desire w/out it? [tu me fascine, je t’aime]; viens, word of fascination, defers in difference what it cannot break with—dare that another dissimulation not come

PAS.content: always the other’s fascination, no opposition to fascination, only differences of force
PAS.linkedContent: always the other’s fascination, no opposition to fascination, only differences of force

PAS.content: le désir de toucher au bord a eu lieu (has taken place), the touching has not, not arrived at its term, sa rive, sa marge ou son bord, sa berge (bank) (ce qui garde et met à l’abri, contre une chute ou une noyade)
PAS.linkedContent: le désir de toucher au bord a eu lieu (has taken place), the touching has not, not arrived at its term, sa rive, sa marge ou son bord, sa berge (bank) (ce qui garde et met à l’abri, contre une chute ou une noyade)

S.content: via Heidegger’s course on Schelling, spirit is only proper if it is close to itself, desire for gathering, a nostalgia, a Sehnsucht, where Sucht, etymologically, isn’t research but evil, evil inscribed in desire > evil as the desire to go out of oneself in order to return to oneself (motif, movement, trajectory of fire, not circle, of return)
S.linkedContent: via Heidegger’s course on Schelling, spirit is only proper if it is close to itself, desire for gathering, a nostalgia, a Sehnsucht, where Sucht, etymologically, isn’t research but evil, evil inscribed in desire > evil as the desire to go out of oneself in order to return to oneself (motif, movement, trajectory of fire, not circle, of return)

S.content: Heidegger: “in spirit there reigns the nostalgia for its own essence”
S.linkedContent: Heidegger: “in spirit there reigns the nostalgia for its own essence”

PPHS.content: for Hegel, theory via vision, is death of desire, desire of death > no consummation of light (can’t be eaten); theoretical: “lets objects persist freely & independently”
PPHS.linkedContent: for Hegel, theory via vision, is death of desire, desire of death > no consummation of light (can’t be eaten); theoretical: “lets objects persist freely & independently”

SH.content: trace or ash: these names stand for other names, a date’s destiny is that of every proper name: is there any other desire than dating, commemorating?
SH.linkedContent: trace or ash: these names stand for other names, a date’s destiny is that of every proper name: is there any other desire than dating, commemorating?

SH.content: poem’s desire or gift, the date is born, in movement of blessing, toward ash
SH.linkedContent: poem’s desire or gift, the date is born, in movement of blessing, toward ash

SH.content: command (appeal, desire, supplication, prayer) [re: imperative beschneide das Wort]
SH.linkedContent: command (appeal, desire, supplication, prayer) [re: imperative beschneide das Wort]

F.content: desire of Wolf Man no longer even his own—l’hôte de ses hôte (haunting of a host of ghosts)
F.linkedContent: desire of Wolf Man no longer even his own—l’hôte de ses hôte (haunting of a host of ghosts)

F.content: le for du dedans (not intérieur) is not le tribunal de la conscience, even though enclosed w/in forum of self > it is the contradiction w/ in desire [?]: father’s penis neither comes [ne jouisse] nor goes [ni ne périsse] > from this contradiction we understand the solidity of crypt, the indefatigable effort to maintain it, & its failures, permeations from w/in & w/out, its seepings
F.linkedContent: le for du dedans (not intérieur) is not le tribunal de la conscience, even though enclosed w/in forum of self > it is the contradiction w/ in desire [?]: father’s penis neither comes [ne jouisse] nor goes [ni ne périsse] > from this contradiction we understand the solidity of crypt, the indefatigable effort to maintain it, & its failures, permeations from w/in & w/out, its seepings

F.content: double desire of crypt, pocket [Genet’s “matchbox,” Glas], pour garder la vie et mettre le mort dans sa poche [near the pudenda], où se tient le plus précieux (money, title, share of stock market): “prise aussi pour le chantage (blackmail) de l’autre”: your wallet or your life
F.linkedContent: double desire of crypt, pocket [Genet’s “matchbox,” Glas], pour garder la vie et mettre le mort dans sa poche [near the pudenda], où se tient le plus précieux (money, title, share of stock market): “prise aussi pour le chantage (blackmail) de l’autre”: your wallet or your life

F.content: every “word” that says Thing in word-thing > several subjects, places, instances; Wolf Man inhabits forbidden desire to call himself by glorious word, can’t not break seal in signing
F.linkedContent: every “word” that says Thing in word-thing > several subjects, places, instances; Wolf Man inhabits forbidden desire to call himself by glorious word, can’t not break seal in signing

F.content: desire for idiom/idiom of desire wrenched open w/in system > never purely idiomatic (absolutely undecipherable) nor simply commonplace (conventional & transparent)
F.linkedContent: desire for idiom/idiom of desire wrenched open w/in system > never purely idiomatic (absolutely undecipherable) nor simply commonplace (conventional & transparent)

DS.content: hymen (hymn): supreme spasm, sign of fusion, consummation, marriage, confusion or identification of two > nonpresence, gaping void of desire, & presence, fullness, satisfaction—now amount to same: yet there is not a single term, no fullness of the signified, it’s the difference that no longer functions (btwn empty signifier/full signified, image/thing)
DS.linkedContent: hymen (hymn): supreme spasm, sign of fusion, consummation, marriage, confusion or identification of two > nonpresence, gaping void of desire, & presence, fullness, satisfaction—now amount to same: yet there is not a single term, no fullness of the signified, it’s the difference that no longer functions (btwn empty signifier/full signified, image/thing)

DS.content: no more spatial heterogeneity of 2 poles: l’accomplissement se résume dans le désir, le désir est (en avance sur) l’accomplissement qui demeure, toujours mimé, un désir, “sans briser la glace”
DS.linkedContent: no more spatial heterogeneity of 2 poles: l’accomplissement se résume dans le désir, le désir est (en avance sur) l’accomplissement qui demeure, toujours mimé, un désir, “sans briser la glace”

DS.content: critical desire, philosophical desire, tries to regain mastery, reads hymen acc. this or that species of presence
DS.linkedContent: critical desire, philosophical desire, tries to regain mastery, reads hymen acc. this or that species of presence

DS.content: dialectical structure can’t account for graphics of hymen, is itself comprehended and inscribed w/in latter, separated from it only by itself, a simple veil that constitutes the very thing that tries to reduce it to nothing: desire
DS.linkedContent: dialectical structure can’t account for graphics of hymen, is itself comprehended and inscribed w/in latter, separated from it only by itself, a simple veil that constitutes the very thing that tries to reduce it to nothing: desire

DS.content: no total/proper meaning because blank folds over (se plie), dès que le blanc (est) blanc, (se) blanchit, as soon as there’s a mark, there’s a re-mark, no blank w/ capital B, no theology of Text, yet desire for reappropriation, structural site of theological trap, is produced, nourished, in very act of separating from it
DS.linkedContent: no total/proper meaning because blank folds over (se plie), dès que le blanc (est) blanc, (se) blanchit, as soon as there’s a mark, there’s a re-mark, no blank w/ capital B, no theology of Text, yet desire for reappropriation, structural site of theological trap, is produced, nourished, in very act of separating from it

P.content: object of 3rd Critique? affect (Gefühl)? pleasure/unpleasure? desire? 1st Critique cuts itself off from interests of desire, excludes desire’s reason, reasons’s desire, desire for reason
P.linkedContent: object of 3rd Critique? affect (Gefühl)? pleasure/unpleasure? desire? 1st Critique cuts itself off from interests of desire, excludes desire’s reason, reasons’s desire, desire for reason

OS.content: transition from parousia to absolute subjectivity does not disrupt Aristotelianism: prime mover, presence, desire, eros, “desire is desire of presence,” absolute subjectivity, circle, return to self, parousia as self-presence > prime mover, noēsis noēseōs, as subject
OS.linkedContent: transition from parousia to absolute subjectivity does not disrupt Aristotelianism: prime mover, presence, desire, eros, “desire is desire of presence,” absolute subjectivity, circle, return to self, parousia as self-presence > prime mover, noēsis noēseōs, as subject

OS.content: must think play of submission & subtraction as formal rule to read history of metaphysics w/in opening of Heidegger’s breakthrough [re: categories such as desire, movement, time]
OS.linkedContent: must think play of submission & subtraction as formal rule to read history of metaphysics w/in opening of Heidegger’s breakthrough [re: categories such as desire, movement, time]

POS.content: what defers presence (its trace, its sign, its representation) is basis of its announcement or desire
POS.linkedContent: what defers presence (its trace, its sign, its representation) is basis of its announcement or desire

ATIA.content: those who wish, out of desire or need, to make an ironclad distinction btwn desire/need
ATIA.linkedContent: those who wish, out of desire or need, to make an ironclad distinction btwn desire/need

PS.content: fatal complicity Artaud reveals: all destructive discourses must inhabit structures they demolish, must shelter indestructible desire for full presence, nondifference: à la fois vie et mort
PS.linkedContent: fatal complicity Artaud reveals: all destructive discourses must inhabit structures they demolish, must shelter indestructible desire for full presence, nondifference: à la fois vie et mort

PS.content: not critiquing Artaud from standpoint of metaphysics, Derrida reveals complicity: Artaud must enclose himself in closure of presence to denounce naive implications w/in difference
PS.linkedContent: not critiquing Artaud from standpoint of metaphysics, Derrida reveals complicity: Artaud must enclose himself in closure of presence to denounce naive implications w/in difference

FS.content: Apollonian ecstasy cannot embrace force, movement which displaces lines, nor force as desire for itself, nor writing > fallen Dionysianism, melancholy, nostalgia
FS.linkedContent: Apollonian ecstasy cannot embrace force, movement which displaces lines, nor force as desire for itself, nor writing > fallen Dionysianism, melancholy, nostalgia

SW.content: where do I get the force/desire to precipitate the verdict w/out end, to the end of time, to precipitate imminence? > my texts have pocketed veils & sails of every sex and gender [French?] (which clothed my entire history): the whole history of our culture in a pocket
SW.linkedContent: where do I get the force/desire to precipitate the verdict w/out end, to the end of time, to precipitate imminence? > my texts have pocketed veils & sails of every sex and gender [French?] (which clothed my entire history): the whole history of our culture in a pocket

DPi.content: can one desire, what is really called desire, an anesthetic?—pure intelligibility (sur-viving beyond life), death as absolute anesthetic
DPi.linkedContent: can one desire, what is really called desire, an anesthetic?—pure intelligibility (sur-viving beyond life), death as absolute anesthetic

REST.content: desire for attribution is a desire for appropriation (in matters of art, & everywhere else)
REST.linkedContent: desire for attribution is a desire for appropriation (in matters of art, & everywhere else)

DST.content: along with Lacoue-Labarthe, urgent to break with familial resemblances (airs), avoid genealogical temptations, assimilation or specular projection
DST.linkedContent: along with Lacoue-Labarthe, urgent to break with familial resemblances (airs), avoid genealogical temptations, assimilation or specular projection

DST.content: and it’s not because they’re impossible that the temptation becomes more avoidable
DST.linkedContent: and it’s not because they’re impossible that the temptation becomes more avoidable

PIO.content: why this new desire for “invention” (not creation, institution, etc.)? that worn-out (usé), classical word? desire for invention dreams of inventing a new desire, still contemporary w/ a certain weariness, exhaustion, but also accompanies a desire for deconstruction (lifting [lever] contradiction that might exist btwn invention/deconstruction)
PIO.linkedContent: why this new desire for “invention” (not creation, institution, etc.)? that worn-out (usé), classical word? desire for invention dreams of inventing a new desire, still contemporary w/ a certain weariness, exhaustion, but also accompanies a desire for deconstruction (lifting [lever] contradiction that might exist btwn invention/deconstruction)

PF.content: paralysis arrests: negative symptom of aporia > whereas aporia is possibility of impossible, of “play,” very condition of pas, experience of frayage, marche, via rupta [elsewhere Derrida deconstructs becoming route?], decision, event, coming of other: writing & desire
PF.linkedContent: paralysis arrests: negative symptom of aporia > whereas aporia is possibility of impossible, of “play,” very condition of pas, experience of frayage, marche, via rupta [elsewhere Derrida deconstructs becoming route?], decision, event, coming of other: writing & desire

TR.content: de Man: “ribbon substituting for a desire which is itself a desire for substitution” [re: Rousseau’s Confessions]
TR.linkedContent: de Man: “ribbon substituting for a desire which is itself a desire for substitution” [re: Rousseau’s Confessions]

TR.content: force of nondesire in desire? force of desubjectivation in/as subject itself?
TR.linkedContent: force of nondesire in desire? force of desubjectivation in/as subject itself?

TR.content: de Man: deconstruction/dissemination independent of any desire (mechanical/arbitrary like a grammar) [Derrida quickly claims this argument is both defensible & indefensible]
TR.linkedContent: de Man: deconstruction/dissemination independent of any desire (mechanical/arbitrary like a grammar) [Derrida quickly claims this argument is both defensible & indefensible]

TR.content: event supposes surprise/contingency, thus exteriority or irreducibility to desire, exappropriation as work of inappropriable in desire > unless nondesire haunts every desire, abyssal attraction btwn the 2 (not simply exclusion, exteriority, opposition)
TR.linkedContent: event supposes surprise/contingency, thus exteriority or irreducibility to desire, exappropriation as work of inappropriable in desire > unless nondesire haunts every desire, abyssal attraction btwn the 2 (not simply exclusion, exteriority, opposition)

TR.content: due to unforeseeable, inappropriable exteriority, event is traumatic (a fearsome generality of “trauma”—there’s trauma of “happy” experience) > makes precarious distinction btwn point of view of subject & that which is produced independently of desire: event injures desire
TR.linkedContent: due to unforeseeable, inappropriable exteriority, event is traumatic (a fearsome generality of “trauma”—there’s trauma of “happy” experience) > makes precarious distinction btwn point of view of subject & that which is produced independently of desire: event injures desire

TR.content: [re: event, trauma] that which makes possible desire, some outside, some nondesire, some death: becoming possible of the impossible as im-possible (inappropriability of the other)[seems the haunting & spectral is Derrida’s addition]
TR.linkedContent: [re: event, trauma] that which makes possible desire, some outside, some nondesire, some death: becoming possible of the impossible as im-possible (inappropriability of the other)[seems the haunting & spectral is Derrida’s addition]

AFR.content: force, analogy, signification will always be ordered to a theory of need (don’t rush to oppose to theory of desire)
AFR.linkedContent: force, analogy, signification will always be ordered to a theory of need (don’t rush to oppose to theory of desire)

AFR.content: Condillac: need as uneasiness caused by absence of object you deem necessary [lack], this uneasiness determines actions of body’s/soul’s faculties, this determination is desire
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac: need as uneasiness caused by absence of object you deem necessary [lack], this uneasiness determines actions of body’s/soul’s faculties, this determination is desire

AFR.content: via Condillac, need is system’s unique principle, desire is its representative vection: need changes into desiring representation in temporal dehiscence of comparison
AFR.linkedContent: via Condillac, need is system’s unique principle, desire is its representative vection: need changes into desiring representation in temporal dehiscence of comparison

AFR.content: need or desire? 1) frivolity comes to need through desire, desire opens direction of object, produces supplying (suppléante) sign, is thin, slight, inconstant 2) need is frivolous, need w/out desire is blind, no object, identical to itself, tautological, autistic: in such a case, desire would moralize need, subject it to law
AFR.linkedContent: need or desire? 1) frivolity comes to need through desire, desire opens direction of object, produces supplying (suppléante) sign, is thin, slight, inconstant 2) need is frivolous, need w/out desire is blind, no object, identical to itself, tautological, autistic: in such a case, desire would moralize need, subject it to law

AFR.content: but don’t forget: in human order, w/ language, commerce, and supplementary deflection, the 2nd is 1st (metaphysics as humanism) > the need to desire (does not belong to nature)
AFR.linkedContent: but don’t forget: in human order, w/ language, commerce, and supplementary deflection, the 2nd is 1st (metaphysics as humanism) > the need to desire (does not belong to nature)

AFR.content: via Condillac, desire no longer a direction, but an end w/out end > moment stone (statue) comes to life, works to reduce gap, (not) become dead again—contrary to frivolous distraction, to headstrong identity of signs: fear of Medusa [fear of frivolous?], legitimacy itself
AFR.linkedContent: via Condillac, desire no longer a direction, but an end w/out end > moment stone (statue) comes to life, works to reduce gap, (not) become dead again—contrary to frivolous distraction, to headstrong identity of signs: fear of Medusa [fear of frivolous?], legitimacy itself

D.content: obsessive desire to escape due to structure of the text, obsession always textual
D.linkedContent: obsessive desire to escape due to structure of the text, obsession always textual

D.content: textuality is obsidional: undecidable process of opening/closing—no letup (sans cesse)
D.linkedContent: textuality is obsidional: undecidable process of opening/closing—no letup (sans cesse)

D.content: semantic order entangled in seminal, that which was never itself, never comes back to itself; semantic, as a moment of desire, signifies reappropriation of seed w/in presence > the seminal’s dream of death: seed wanting to keep itself
D.linkedContent: semantic order entangled in seminal, that which was never itself, never comes back to itself; semantic, as a moment of desire, signifies reappropriation of seed w/in presence > the seminal’s dream of death: seed wanting to keep itself

C.content: send oneself [TN. s’envoyer, “get landed w/,” “make it w/”] the remainder, that’s (the) desire, and its impossibility
C.linkedContent: send oneself [TN. s’envoyer, “get landed w/,” “make it w/”] the remainder, that’s (the) desire, and its impossibility

LI.content: “self-presence” as desire/need is not simply a linguistic superstition Derrida keeps alive to win an argument, it is indestructible, “immortal”—also death, mortifère (death bearing) > is not “pure realization of self presence” also death?
LI.linkedContent: “self-presence” as desire/need is not simply a linguistic superstition Derrida keeps alive to win an argument, it is indestructible, “immortal”—also death, mortifère (death bearing) > is not “pure realization of self presence” also death?

TN.content: desire is intuitionistic—as soon as it’s weaned (sevré) of intuition > lethal contradiction, sign of its end, its telos (telos is haptico-intuitionistic)
TN.linkedContent: desire is intuitionistic—as soon as it’s weaned (sevré) of intuition > lethal contradiction, sign of its end, its telos (telos is haptico-intuitionistic)

TN.content: Deleuze & Guattari’s preference of “haptic” to “tactile”: proximity > a continuistic postulation of desire, “smooth,” “body w/out organs”
TN.linkedContent: Deleuze & Guattari’s preference of “haptic” to “tactile”: proximity > a continuistic postulation of desire, “smooth,” “body w/out organs”

TN.content: intuitionistic-continuistic logic of immediacy as irrepressible as desire itself, as intractable as language constraints, grammatical violence > this law has to happen, symptoms will crop up [does Nancy really avoid this logic?]
TN.linkedContent: intuitionistic-continuistic logic of immediacy as irrepressible as desire itself, as intractable as language constraints, grammatical violence > this law has to happen, symptoms will crop up [does Nancy really avoid this logic?]

TN.content: who could finish w/ this tempting postulation? [i.e. “smooth” desire]
TN.linkedContent: who could finish w/ this tempting postulation? [i.e. “smooth” desire]

TN.content: proper, ipseity, proche, “same” are all deconstructible [but try to speak w/out them!], beyond their pedagogical and rhetorical necessity, what do they ever mean? the law that hatches irresistible desire of appropriation (“my body,” “here”) destines it to expropriation > this desire handed over to promise of expropriation [Derrida is deconstructing Nancy’s “properly”]
TN.linkedContent: proper, ipseity, proche, “same” are all deconstructible [but try to speak w/out them!], beyond their pedagogical and rhetorical necessity, what do they ever mean? the law that hatches irresistible desire of appropriation (“my body,” “here”) destines it to expropriation > this desire handed over to promise of expropriation [Derrida is deconstructing Nancy’s “properly”]

TN.content: touch as self-touching—le toucher plus tout autre sens (dizzy rhetoric), very form of space & time & will (essence of will) (from Descartes to Kant or even to Nietzsche)
TN.linkedContent: touch as self-touching—le toucher plus tout autre sens (dizzy rhetoric), very form of space & time & will (essence of will) (from Descartes to Kant or even to Nietzsche)

TN.content: to will is to will to touch, strange tautology, bends/folds oneself back into fold of passive-active auto-affection > this affect, that inflects/conjugates passive activity of will: desire
TN.linkedContent: to will is to will to touch, strange tautology, bends/folds oneself back into fold of passive-active auto-affection > this affect, that inflects/conjugates passive activity of will: desire

TN.content: heart: condition of desire, the effraction of the other, of what can’t return to self
TN.linkedContent: heart: condition of desire, the effraction of the other, of what can’t return to self

TN.content: diastole, absolute generosity, generosity more generous than generosity itself, orients us toward epekeina tēs ousisas, Plotinus’ One
TN.linkedContent: diastole, absolute generosity, generosity more generous than generosity itself, orients us toward epekeina tēs ousisas, Plotinus’ One

TN.content: “facts of the day” [i.e. computer, cybersex], artefactual haunts and works through technics & desire (and work in general)—same labor, same pleasure, same torture, tripalium
TN.linkedContent: “facts of the day” [i.e. computer, cybersex], artefactual haunts and works through technics & desire (and work in general)—same labor, same pleasure, same torture, tripalium

AD.content: à of à l’infini and à-Dieu: ad-dresses, opens relation, responds to, responsible for > desire says A-Dieu
AD.linkedContent: à of à l’infini and à-Dieu: ad-dresses, opens relation, responds to, responsible for > desire says A-Dieu

AD.content: Levinas: à-Dieu is infinitely older than finite, diachrony of time “being destined” before any act of consciousness, destined as devotion itself, desire refers to à-Dieu, which is more profound, older than cogito
AD.linkedContent: Levinas: à-Dieu is infinitely older than finite, diachrony of time “being destined” before any act of consciousness, destined as devotion itself, desire refers to à-Dieu, which is more profound, older than cogito

AD.content: (Psalms 132:13) desire of Yahweh to reside > no desire w/out elective claim, w/out exclusive request for singular residence
AD.linkedContent: (Psalms 132:13) desire of Yahweh to reside > no desire w/out elective claim, w/out exclusive request for singular residence

CIN.content: a desire, order, prayer or promise: “another voice, may it come soon now, again, another voice…”
CIN.linkedContent: a desire, order, prayer or promise: “another voice, may it come soon now, again, another voice…”

BSi.content: for Derrida, hypothesis that bêtise always threatens imperturbable ithyphallus is the essential ithyphallic bêtise > ithyphallus’ hyperbolical desire is nil/empty of thought, this void pushes, pulses, compulses, makes one think of a drive that is absolutely bête, never gives up anything, absolute stranger to all thought
BSi.linkedContent: for Derrida, hypothesis that bêtise always threatens imperturbable ithyphallus is the essential ithyphallic bêtise > ithyphallus’ hyperbolical desire is nil/empty of thought, this void pushes, pulses, compulses, makes one think of a drive that is absolutely bête, never gives up anything, absolute stranger to all thought

OG.content: desire to restrict (lier) le jeu is irresistible
OG.linkedContent: desire to restrict (lier) le jeu is irresistible

OG.content: the bricoleur (whose difference from engineer requires creationist theology) can’t account for already-thereness (déjà-là) of language—in which desire deludes itself
OG.linkedContent: the bricoleur (whose difference from engineer requires creationist theology) can’t account for already-thereness (déjà-là) of language—in which desire deludes itself

OG.content: supplement as chain itself, theory of textuality, en abyme, structural necessity of abyss, desire of presence born in abyss
OG.linkedContent: supplement as chain itself, theory of textuality, en abyme, structural necessity of abyss, desire of presence born in abyss

OG.content: nature as limit concept—impossible equilibrium btwn reserve & desire, imagination breaks equilibrium, desire must leave its reserve; acc. Rousseau, ethics: to come closest to this limit
OG.linkedContent: nature as limit concept—impossible equilibrium btwn reserve & desire, imagination breaks equilibrium, desire must leave its reserve; acc. Rousseau, ethics: to come closest to this limit

OG.content: acc. Rousseau, imitation & pity have same foundation: sort of metaphorical ecstasy > Rousseau: imitation rooted in perpetual desire to transport ourselves beyond ourselves
OG.linkedContent: acc. Rousseau, imitation & pity have same foundation: sort of metaphorical ecstasy > Rousseau: imitation rooted in perpetual desire to transport ourselves beyond ourselves

OG.content: supplementarity is nothing, not absence, presence, not essence/substance of man: it’s the opening of play (jeu) btwn presence/absence, dislocation of proper of man, the impossibility and thus the desire for proximity to self (pure presence)
OG.linkedContent: supplementarity is nothing, not absence, presence, not essence/substance of man: it’s the opening of play (jeu) btwn presence/absence, dislocation of proper of man, the impossibility and thus the desire for proximity to self (pure presence)

OG.content: [vis-à-vis Rousseau] no opposition applied to passage btwn state of nature & state of society, to becoming-present of presence (a lasting passage like the present in Reveries): a supplementarity, festival (fête), w/out jeu; moment of festival: pure continuity > society formed morrow of festival (indifference of pleasure & desire): de la danse à la loi
OG.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Rousseau] no opposition applied to passage btwn state of nature & state of society, to becoming-present of presence (a lasting passage like the present in Reveries): a supplementarity, festival (fête), w/out jeu; moment of festival: pure continuity > society formed morrow of festival (indifference of pleasure & desire): de la danse à la loi

OG.content: w/in play of supplementarity, signified always replaced w/ another signifier; prohibition of incest doesn’t escape play [deconstructing decisive institution of law, eg. Lacan]
OG.linkedContent: w/in play of supplementarity, signified always replaced w/ another signifier; prohibition of incest doesn’t escape play [deconstructing decisive institution of law, eg. Lacan]

OG.content: language couples prohibition & transgression endlessly, point of nonreplacement doesn’t exist > that which is elusive in our indestructible & mortal desire
OG.linkedContent: language couples prohibition & transgression endlessly, point of nonreplacement doesn’t exist > that which is elusive in our indestructible & mortal desire

OG.content: local difference: differance btwn desire & pleasure
“to supplant/compensate for (suppléer)” defines writing, adds itself to presence, defers it in indestructible desire to rejoin it
OG.linkedContent: “to supplant/compensate for (suppléer)” defines writing, adds itself to presence, defers it in indestructible desire to rejoin it

OG.content: for Rousseau, imagination irritates/ravages desire, representation (North, winter, death) as danger of supplement—whose efficiency is of the imagination
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, imagination irritates/ravages desire, representation (North, winter, death) as danger of supplement—whose efficiency is of the imagination

OG.content: writing/double opens desire and re-gardent la jouissance—Rousseau searches for un salut (haven) dans l’écriture
OG.linkedContent: writing/double opens desire and re-gardent la jouissance—Rousseau searches for un salut (haven) dans l’écriture

CIR.content: Latin uum mimes fluid I desire to keep, desire as what is kept, keeping not object but continuum of desire; narcissistic self-involvement: libido returns upon itself at moment of loss (approximative, false jargon)
CIR.linkedContent: Latin uum mimes fluid I desire to keep, desire as what is kept, keeping not object but continuum of desire; narcissistic self-involvement: libido returns upon itself at moment of loss (approximative, false jargon)

SPEC.content: in German, Lust (pleasure) also designates jouissance and desire
SPEC.linkedContent: in German, Lust (pleasure) also designates jouissance and desire

SPEC.content: Freud’s auto-affective structure of time, life as the auto-affection of death, differance lodged in desire (desire nothing but this) for this auto-tely: auto-delegates & arrives only by differing in tout autre [for Freud, life-death announced to serve the proper, an economy of death]
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud’s auto-affective structure of time, life as the auto-affection of death, differance lodged in desire (desire nothing but this) for this auto-tely: auto-delegates & arrives only by differing in tout autre [for Freud, life-death announced to serve the proper, an economy of death]

SPEC.content: w/ Causa, l’Autre Chose—no opposition btwn pleasure & unpleasure, w/in & beyond, life & death: graphics of strictural supplement not oppositional, knowns no negation, no lack; in graphics, desire is sans “sans,” is of a “sans sans sans”
SPEC.linkedContent: w/ Causa, l’Autre Chose—no opposition btwn pleasure & unpleasure, w/in & beyond, life & death: graphics of strictural supplement not oppositional, knowns no negation, no lack; in graphics, desire is sans “sans,” is of a “sans sans sans”

FV.content: [re: Poe’s Purloined…] no neutralization possible when public corporation (société anonyme) of capital & desire inaugurates narration
FV.linkedContent: [re: Poe’s Purloined…] no neutralization possible when public corporation (société anonyme) of capital & desire inaugurates narration
